results.title: Quarantini Anyone? When Everyday Drinking Becomes a Problem
results.abstract: As weeks in lockdown pile up, what started out as a way to unwind may start to feel like an unexpectedly stubborn habit.
org_facet: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism

results.title: Top E.U. Diplomat: Disinformation Report not Watered Down for China
results.abstract: Josep Borrell said that China expressed its concerns over the report, but he would not explain how. European lawmakers appeared skeptical.

multimedia.caption: The European Union’s senior diplomat, Josep Borrell, acknowledged that Chinese officials had objected to the report, but said such objections are “are the daily bread of diplomacy.”

results.title: Trump’s Order to Keep Meat Plants Operating
results.abstract: A reader criticizes the move, saying it puts workers at risk and is a wrongheaded use of the Defense Production Act. Also: Visiting coronavirus patients in the hospital; Bernie Sanders’s supporters.

multimedia.caption: Food companies have been drawing on stockpiles of meat in cold storage, but they have warned that supplies to supermarkets could soon dwindle if plants remain closed amid illnesses.

results.title: Madeline Kripke, Doyenne of Dictionaries, Is Dead at 76
results.abstract: A woman of many words, mostly unspoken, she amassed a lexicographic trove of some 20,000 books, much of it crammed into her Greenwich Village apartment.

multimedia.caption: Madeline Kripke in her Greenwich Village apartment in 2013 with part of her vast dictionary collection. “Madeline built a cathedral of the English lexicographic tradition,” an admirer said.

results.abstract: NASA's new ICESat-2 satellite provides the most detailed look yet of where the continent is losing and gaining ice.

results.title: El paseo del puma
results.abstract: Proscritos del espacio público, rodeados de un silencio inverosímil, nos movemos en círculos, como pumas encerrados.

results.title: Ava DuVernay and Patty Jenkins Get the Funko Pops Treatment

results.title: Coronavirus Rules: Should Other States Still Follow New York?
results.abstract: Readers differ about Bret Stephens’s opinion that a New York-style order doesn’t need to be applied in less affected areas.

results.title: Want to Be an Instant Expert on Film Noir? Watch This Drama
results.abstract: For a crash course on a category that can be hard to pin down, Nicholas Ray’s psychologically complex “In a Lonely Place” has it all, starting with a sneering Bogart.

results.title: Same Winery, Separate Labels
results.abstract: These six producers share a common point of view and work in the same facility, yet they are each making distinctive, individualistic wines.

results.title: The Tricky Dance of Sharing a Winery in the Pandemic Era
results.abstract: For six producers who form a mutually beneficial winemaking community in Sonoma, Covid-19 poses practical and financial obstacles beyond health.

multimedia.caption: Shown before the pandemic, from left, Pax Mahle, Scott Schultz, Jaimee Motley, Martha Stoumen and Carlo Mondavi. They all make their own wines, sharing space in Mr. Mahle’s production facility.

results.title: High School Seniors Are Making Yearbooks on Instagram
results.abstract: The class of 2020 has given up prom, graduation and other rites, but they’re sharing memories and celebrating each other’s achievements online.
